image.altText: A person placing debris in a fire on a road

props.synopsis: Street protests erupt in Los Angeles, the United States' second-largest city, after sweeping immigration raids by ICE agents.

title.children: White House sends National Guard to protests against LA immigration raids

image.altText: A black bed frame with dark sheets and a small table lamp nearby lit up in darkness.

props.synopsis: "Are you losing sleep tonight, like I am?" They're not just the lyrics to a country music heartbreaker but a question Australians should be asking each other to avoid some major health issues.

title.children: 'Every cell, every organ': Sleep issues affecting 40 per cent of Australians

image.altText: Mugshot of a woman with blonde hair

props.synopsis: Lucy Letby is currently serving multiple life sentences after being convicted of murdering seven babies and attempting to kill others. There's only one problem: the group of experts saying there's no evidence of wrongdoing.

title.children: Convicted baby killer Lucy Letby is in prison for life. There's just one problem

image.altText: Elon Musk stands in front of a screen displaying an American flag.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump warns Elon Musk could face "serious consequences" if his former ally and campaign benefactor tries to help Democrats in upcoming elections.

title.children: Trump warns Musk of 'serious consequences' if he backs Democrats at midterms

image.altText: A young girl in a white dress.

props.synopsis: Life seemed picture perfect for Lauren Flanigan and her young daughter, Sophia Rose — until the day the three-year-old with the beaming smile was allegedly murdered by her mother. It's left a family shattered and a community reeling.

title.children: How a picture-perfect family was shattered by a senseless tragedy

image.altText: The Royal Darwin Hospital building seen from a distance,  on a sunny day, with a red flower bush in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The investigation follows the death of an Indigenous man at Royal Darwin Hospital's intensive care unit.

title.children: Death in custody probe launched after Indigenous man dies at NT hospital

image.altText: James Paterson addresses the media at parliament house

props.synopsis: The Coalition remains committed to its defence spending target of 3 per cent of gross domestic product by the end of the decade, as Shadow Finance Minister James Paterson suggested the opposition would be open to considering broader tax reform.

title.children: Coalition sticks to defence spending pledge but won't say how it'll pay for it

image.altText: A dark blue piano from birds eye view with the words Classic 100 Piano written on top, on a background of colourful swirls

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of Australians have cast their votes in the 2025 Classic 100: Piano. Join us as we countdown to #1.

title.children: The Classic 100: Piano countdown has begun but who will be #1?

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: So much of politics is the art of compromise. It's an art form the Victorian Liberals are unwilling to practice as the party once again rips itself apart over the fate of former leader John Pesutto.

title.children: As John Pesutto faces bankruptcy, the Victorian Liberals can't compromise

image.altText: A boy smiles as hit sits with other students at desks in a makeshift classroom in Gaza.

props.synopsis: With many of Gaza's schools damaged, destroyed or turned into shelters, makeshift classrooms have been set up in tents for the few children who can continue their education amidst the ongoing war.

title.children: With schools destroyed or used as shelter, many Gazan kids learn in tents

image.altText: Dean Winter standing in the chamber.

props.synopsis: The leaders of both of Tasmania's major political parties double down on their support for the proposed Macquarie Point stadium as an early election appears likely.

title.children: 'Not giving it up for anything': Tasmanian Labor leader firm on stadium

image.altText: Pine trees line a hill next to a river with mountains in the distance.

props.synopsis: The US president plans to open up fossil fuel extraction in the Alaskan wilderness but big oil and gas have not exactly been champing at the bit.

title.children: Trump loves Alaska oil plans but critics urge him to 'think, baby, think'

image.altText: Sir David Attenborough 'appalled' about human impact on ocean floor

props.synopsis: The 99-year-old documentarian tells the heir to the British throne he hopes his latest film helps create awareness about the state of destruction in underwater environments.

title.children: David Attenborough tells Prince William of 'unspeakable' human impact on oceans

image.altText: School girls carry signs including 'Cool People don't deserve a warm planet', students march behind them.

props.synopsis: Fossil fuels are warming the planet. Liberal democracy is under attack. Does Australia's government understand what's happening?

title.children: The planet warms, liberal democracy is attacked: Does the government care?

image.altText: A man standing in front of a house.

props.synopsis: Don James is the "talk of the town" after his extraordinary fight with a kangaroo, and learns a valuable lesson about how stressed animals can react after significant disruption to their habitats.

title.children: Man survives fight with stressed roo by throwing 'backward elbows'

image.altText: Black smoking brick building with some floors collapsed in.

props.synopsis: Two waves of Russian attacks targeting the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv kill at least four, injuring more, as hopes of peace dim.

title.children: Key Ukraine city hit by 'most powerful attack' since start of war

image.altText: Close-up of a farmer’s hand holding freshly harvested rice grains before processing at the new mill.

props.synopsis: Rice farmers have opened a $10 million mill, breaking a century-long monopoly and positioning themselves to process and sell different varieties.

title.children: How a group of rice growers funded and built their own mill

image.altText: Coco Gauf kisses the French Open trophy, with orange clay court in the background

props.synopsis: Coco Gauff continues a spectacular season for American women at the grand slams, battling from a set down to topple world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the French Open final.

title.children: Gauff dedicates French Open win to 'Americans who look like me'

image.altText: A white middle-aged couple sitting together, smiling, at a timber dining table, a mantle holding ceramic objects behind them

props.synopsis: Three years after the sudden death of her husband, author Geraldine Brooks retreated to Flinders Island to do the work of grief.

title.children: Why Geraldine Brooks went to Flinders Island to mourn her husband

image.altText: A blonde politician sitting on a chair for a photo.

props.synopsis: The Canberra Liberals leader says coercive control stripped power, freedom and independence from the two women closest to her.

title.children: Leanne Castley's plea to outlaw coercive control is painfully personal

image.altText: A young Thai man looks towards the camera.

props.synopsis: Pinta Nattapong, 35, was working in Israel as a farm worker when he was kidnapped from Kibbutz Nir Oz and killed in captivity shortly afterwards, according to the Israeli government.

title.children: Israel retrieves body of Thai hostage kidnapped during October 7 attacks

image.altText: A boy wearing black and a traditional waistmat walks between two windows shaped like a crucifix at a church.

props.synopsis: Tonga is so serious about the Sabbath that it banned most Sunday trading. Now the king and police are urging people to keep the day holy.

title.children: Tonga strictly keeps the Sabbath. Some say it's gone too far

image.altText: Three different polaroid images of the same young girl

props.synopsis: Police confirm they have discovered human remains near the Good Night National Park near Gin Gin.

title.children: Police confirm human remains found in search for missing teen Pheobe Bishop

image.altText: Protest sign at World Pride

props.synopsis: Washington DC was chosen as host city for WorldPride before last year's re-election of Donald Trump. But his presence in the White House has sent a strong fight-the-government theme running through all its events.

title.children: WorldPride Washington strikes a protest note on Trump's doorstep

image.altText: A woman holding her three-week-old baby in hospital

props.synopsis: A Queensland mother has written a book to help grieving families after navigating her own agonising loss following the death of her baby girl.

title.children: Pixie-Rose only lived for three weeks, but she taught her mum about life

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou and Son Heung-min embrace after a Premier League match.

props.synopsis: In the wake of Ange Postecoglou's sacking, Tottenham Hotspur captain Son Heung-min describes working with the Australian as an "incredible privilege".

title.children: 'Legend forever': Spurs skipper pens emotional tribute to sacked Postecoglou

image.altText: Peter Luck standing on the outside of his floating caravan he built.

props.synopsis: A cancer diagnosis led Peter Luck to build a houseboat that he and his wife are now touring the waterways of Australia in.

title.children: Cancer diagnosis prompts WA man to build a floating caravan

image.altText: Justis Huni and Fabio Wardley in their boxing bout

props.synopsis: Australian heavyweight Justis Huni's valiant bid for the WBA interim world title ends in a devastating 10th-round knockout against rising English star Fabio Wardley.

title.children: Aussie Huni handed shock KO in UK showdown

image.altText: Two people holding a sign that says Labor Climate Criminals

props.synopsis: The WA government claims gas produced in WA is needed to help other nations steer clear of coal and decarbonise after the approval of a 40-year extension to the North West Shelf Karratha project.

title.children: The premier says WA is helping to reduce global emissions. Is there truth to this?

image.altText: Roger Cook wears a blue suit as he smiles while standing on a train

props.synopsis: The Thornlie-Cockburn link and adjacent rail elevation in Perth's south-east is part of WA Labor's flagship infrastructure project Metronet.

title.children: Perth's first east-west rail connection opens after 18 months of disruption

image.altText: A boy sleeps in a hospital bed. Monitoring devices are attached to his chest.

props.synopsis: Kobi Jones was at football training when he started to experience chest pain. Not long after that, he was being treated for a potentially cancerous tumour, all but unheard of in people of his age.

title.children: 'Fit, healthy' 13-year-old's family rocked by rare tumour diagnosis

image.altText: Success Library Social Workers 2025-05-22 08:05:00

props.synopsis: A Perth library trials a social worker program after noticing an increase in people using libraries as a safe space.

title.children: 'She didn't want to leave': Program to help people using libraries as safe spaces

image.altText: A rocky wall where beach sand dunes used to stand

props.synopsis: The Gold Coast's "A-Line" rock wall is the last of defence for nearby properties, and high tides keep crashing against it.

title.children: 'Fringing reef' proposed to save Surfers Paradise from future cyclones

image.altText: a bunch of grapes on a vine in sunlight

props.synopsis: Cotton Candy, Fire Crush, and Midnight Beauty are among a variety of new grapes making their way into Australian supermarkets as growers race to keep up with consumer demand.

title.children: Why you're seeing new grape varieties at the supermarket
